Drugs mule Michaella McCollum Connolly has broken her recent silence to send a thank you message to her supporters. 
Now 24 and blonde, the woman, from County Tyrone, Northern Ireland, was jailed in Peru 2013 after she was caught with a pal concealing cocaine worth £1.5million in their luggage. 
She was stopped with Melissa Reid from Glasgow at Jorge Chávez International Airport in Lima, when their luggage was found to contain 11 kg of cocaine. 
They initially claimed they had been forced to carry the drugs by an armed gang but subsequently pleaded guilty to drug smuggling, reports Belfast Live. 
Both women were sentenced to six years and eight months in prison in December 2013, and Michaela was paroled and returned home after serving two years and three months in jail. Video Loading Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now
